page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW OF BLOCK
page.content: The block comprises parts of 4 civil parishes, more than half being in Inwardleigh and the remainder being divided between Northlew and Okehampton Hamlets with a small corner being in Beaworthy parish. The area is mainly a plateau about 600 to 700 feet above sea level a few miles north of Dartmoor. It is criss-crossed with brooks which feed into the River Lew, a tributory of the Torridge. The land is mostly farmland used to graze cattle and sheep, but there are also some areas of woodland and some arable crops. Housing is mostly isolated farm houses and cottages of traditional cob construction although some have been extensively modernised. Although there is some tourism in the area to augment income from farming the lanes are generally free from heavy traffic even at the height of the holiday season.
